body_html: I haven't really delved into the whole Bazel stamping thing yet, but shouldn't the git hash be a dependency of only a small part of the whole project? E.g. to rename the final artefacts or maybe to put in a version.h header that isn't #included anywhere. I don't see why the entire project would need to depend on the git hash.
body_text: I haven't really delved into the whole Bazel stamping thing yet, but shouldn't the git hash be a dependency of only a small part of the whole project? E.g. to rename the final artefacts or maybe to put in a version.h header that isn't #included anywhere. I don't see why the entire project would need to depend on the git hash.
body: I haven't really delved into the whole Bazel stamping thing yet, but shouldn't the git hash be a dependency of only a small part of the whole project? E.g. to rename the final artefacts or maybe to put in a `version.h` header that isn't `#include`d anywhere. I don't see why the entire project would need to depend on the git hash.
